channel.title: taiwan soccer on Taipei City FC Test Site
channel.description: Recent content in taiwan soccer on Taipei City FC Test Site

item.title: A Flood of Goals on a Wettish Day
item.description: Time: 10am, November 7th, 2010 Venue: Bai Ling Bridge Riverside Park By Michael Christie There was a nice, slick surface, if a little wet and slippery in places, at Bai Ling for when Taipei City kicked off their BML campaign against JFC on Sunday morning at 9am. The slick surface meant that the ball skidded quickly over longer distances than usual, so everything was set up for a good game between two teams that like to pass.

item.title: Amateur Soccer Leagues set for Thrilling Finales
item.description: By John Phillips Taipei Times Saturday, Mar 13, 2010 At least one of Taipei’s amateur soccer leagues will be decided tomorrow as Da-an face the Red Lions needing to win by at least three clear goals to snatch the Carnegies Premier League (CPL) title at 1pm at Taipei’s Dajia Riverside Park. Across the city at Shilin’s Bai­ling Bridge at 4pm, expat team Taipei City can take a huge step toward clinching their second Businessman’s League (BML) trophy when they take on Sanchung High School.
